metadata.title: CVE-2022-48619 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/input/input.c in the Linux kernel before5.17.10. An attacker can cause a denial of service (panic) becauseinput_set_capability mishandles the situation in which an event code fallsoutside of a bitmap.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-191.202').
